availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Griffin Byars (Shelby County, Kentucky, assessor)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, assessor. Shelby County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary E. Fisher Byars in Shelby County, Kentucky, on September 13, 1854. Father of Edwin Dillard Byars, James Francis Byars, and Thomas Byars. Assistant assessor for Shelby County in 1862. Assessor for Shelby County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 5, p. 496A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994054, Shelby County Marriages, p. 4 of 20 of microfilm.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994054, Shelby County Births, p. 3.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Shelby County, KY, July 1863, p. 27.
